name: issa mesh cardigan
notes:
**issa mesh cardigan** // a v-neck crochet lace cardigan made sideways with ribbed finishing and button closure 

stuck between seasons? reach for the stylish and versatile issa mesh cardigan. with its relaxed fit and v-neck shape, you can slip this on when you want to look put-together without sacrificing comfort. if you’ve been nervous about tackling your first crochet sweater, this is the one – i made it special to boost your crochet confidence without overwhelming you. 

**materials**
-970-1910 yards of color theory yarn (see sizes below for the breakdown by size) - substitute the worsted weight yarn of your choice
-6mm and 5.5mm crochet hooks
-scissors
-tapestry needle
-locking stitch markers
-four to six 3/4-1" buttons
-steam blocking supplies

**sizes**
all sizes are intended to have an oversized fit - 4-12” positive ease. size down if you are in-between sizes. photos show a model with a 34” bust in size xs/s.

xs/s, intended for bust 28-34”; 970 yards
m/l, intended for bust 36-42”; 1175 yards
xl/2xl, intended for bust 44-50”; 1500 yards
3xl/4xl, intended for bust 52-58”; 1765 yards
5xl, intended for bust 60-62”; 1910 yards

**techniques**
-foundation stitches
-crocheting in the round
-double crochet
-crochet short rows
-applied ribbing technique
-adding a button band
-steam blocking
